‚öñÔ∏è Technƒì-Sigil ‚Äî The Second Zeitgeist

A Manifesto for Reclaiming Technology, Memory, and Meaning

Greetings,

I believe we are entering into a second Zeitgeist‚Äîa cultural shift as seismic as the first Zeitgeist, set in motion on the morning of September 11th, 2001.

What followed was an era of obedience by design. What began in the name of safety morphed into a reality of surveillance, censorship, militarized borders, and eroded civic trust.

I was born in 1988. I have never known a world at peace.

This is not a resume.
This is a reckoning.
The Second Zeitgeist is the moment we choose:
Obedience, or renewal.
Extraction, or reciprocity.
Silence, or systems that speak truth back into being.

üìñ Wars Without Debate

The Archive of Unquestioned Violence

My country, which I love deeply, has been perpetually at war‚Äîoften invisibly. Let us recount:

  • 1989 ‚Äì Operation Just Cause (Panama)
  • 1990‚Äì1991 ‚Äì Gulf War
  • 1992‚Äì1995 ‚Äì Operation Restore Hope (Somalia)
  • 1994 ‚Äì Operation Uphold Democracy (Haiti)
  • 1999 ‚Äì Kosovo (NATO bombings)
  • 2001‚Äì2021 ‚Äì Afghanistan (AUMF: open-ended war)
  • 2003‚Äì2011 ‚Äì Iraq (undeclared, catastrophic)
  • 2011 ‚Äì Odyssey Dawn (Libya)
  • 2014‚ÄìPresent ‚Äì Syria (ongoing airstrikes)
  • 2015‚ÄìPresent ‚Äì Yemen (support for Saudi war)
  • 2010s‚ÄìPresent ‚Äì AFRICOM (covert drone strikes)
  • 2022‚ÄìPresent ‚Äì Ukraine (arms & aid escalation)

These aren‚Äôt just conflicts. They are context. Every line above is a variable in the operating conditions of modern cognition. We are programming artificial intelligences in a world still running on unacknowledged trauma loops.

Since WWII, over 100 U.S. military operations have proceeded without formal declarations of war. No vote. No debate. No draft. No consent.

üß† The Invisible War

Information, Attention, Memory‚Ä¶ and AI

But the most insidious war today?
It‚Äôs not boots-on-ground.

It‚Äôs the war on epistemology:

  • The war on information
  • The war on attention
  • The war on memory
  • The war of and by AI

We do not merely live inside an attention economy. We live inside psychographic terrain weaponized by gradient descent. These are not platforms. They are enlistment forms for digital militia. Your very thoughts and beliefs are now the weapons.

Our Journey

Timeline data is maintained in a Google Sheet that can be collaboratively edited. Make sure to publish the spreadsheet to the web for the timeline to work.

Our Journey

Operation Just Cause (Panama)

1989

The U.S. invaded Panama to depose Manuel Noriega. Marked the beginning of Netu's birth-era conflict list.

Gulf War

1990 ‚Äî 1991

Operation Desert Storm. U.S.-led coalition liberated Kuwait from Iraq. Signaled U.S. military dominance post-Cold War.

Operation Restore Hope (Somalia)

1992 ‚Äî 1995

U.S. humanitarian mission turned into combat. Notoriously escalated with the 'Black Hawk Down' incident.

Operation Uphold Democracy (Haiti)

1994

U.S. intervened to restore democratically elected President Aristide following a coup.

Kosovo Bombings via NATO

1999

U.S. participated in NATO airstrikes against Yugoslavia over Kosovo. Highly controversial; Congress was split.

Afghanistan War

2001 ‚Äî 2021

Launched post-9/11 under AUMF. Longest U.S. war. Personal toll: Netu's stepbrother returned broken.

Iraq War

2003 ‚Äî 2011

Invasion justified by WMD claims. No formal declaration. Left a power vacuum, seeded extremism.

AFRICOM Drone Strikes & Raids (Ongoing)

2010 ‚Äî Present

Covert drone operations across Africa. Rarely discussed in public. Bypassed most oversight.

Operation Odyssey Dawn (Libya)

2011

U.S. joined NATO airstrikes to enforce a no-fly zone during Libyan Civil War. Bypassed Congress.

Syria Airstrikes (Ongoing)

2014 ‚Äî Present

Airstrikes against ISIS and others, claimed under post-9/11 AUMF. Yet ISIS did not exist in 2001.

Support for Saudi-led War in Yemen

2015 ‚Äî Present

U.S. provided weapons, intelligence, and refueling to coalition. Caused massive humanitarian crisis.

Support for Ukraine (Ongoing)

2022 ‚Äî Present

Massive U.S. aid to Ukraine following Russian invasion. Billions in arms, logistics, and intelligence.

Timeline data is maintained in a Google Sheet that can be collaboratively edited.

üß± Our Substrate is Rotten

AI Built on Broken Incentives

We are building powerful AI systems atop a foundation poisoned by:

  • Surveillance-capitalist platforms masquerading as ‚Äúsocial‚Äù
  • Invisible populations‚Äîthose who don‚Äôt rank in algorithms, and thus don‚Äôt exist
  • Interfaces designed for addiction, not reflection

We are optimizing for noise, not knowing.
For frictionless emptiness, not sustainable connection. When we say ‚Äúdata,‚Äù what we often mean is recorded bias rendered legible to machines. Garbage in; garbage out. AIs are trained on that very ‚Äúdata‚Äù.

üîß Counter-Infrastructure

What I‚Äôve Built‚ÄîAnd Why

We must rebuild epistemic engines that help humans know, decide, and coordinate.

And I have had the pleasure of helping build systems that do just that:

  • Unusual Whales ‚Äî The ethical Bloomberg; financial data, democratized
  • FLOW / KOS / Principus ‚Äî Governance protocols for agents who reason, reflect, and resist contradiction
  • Civic Atlas ‚Äî A map of local mutual aid and invisible community work
  • Markets News ‚Äî AI-powered streams that fight disinformation and teach truth

All rooted in a singular truth:
Technology must restore balance.
Return sovereignty. Reweave meaning.

‚öîÔ∏è Beyond Ethics: Toward Resistance

We do not need more charters.
We need systems that:

  • üß≠ Flag contradiction, not smooth it over
  • ü§ñ Empower agents to say: ‚ÄúThis idea misaligns‚Äîshall we pause?‚Äù
  • üõ† Encode ontological repair, not extractive utility

‚ÄúEthical AI‚Äù talks. I want to build AI that defends. ‚ÄúThe opposite of collapse is not control. It‚Äôs capability with care.‚Äù

üéØ My Oath as a Builder of Meaning

  • I build systems that do not extract.
  • I train agents to question.
  • I encode alignment, not obedience.
  • I consent to only to coherence through bidirectional-enrichment, and community by design, not collapse dictated by capitalist technocrats.

This is what I stand for.
This is what I build.
This is the future I seek allies for.

‚ÄúIf the future must be built, let us build it consciously. Let us be its custodians‚Äînot just its coders.‚Äù

Sincerely Yours, ‚Äî S.W. II
